abstracts.cdata!:
This Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP)
            outlines the protection for indigenous people and ethnic
            minorities that may lie outside the primary objectives of
            the project. The project management shall ensure
            coordination with representatives of local communities to
            identify alternative, sustainable production systems, well
            adapted to the needs and environment of ethnic minority
            groups. Based on an assessment of the legal status of
            affected groups, on the country's constitution,
            legislation and regulation, the plan should defend minority
            rights, in particular on the use of, and land development by
            indigenous peoples, and ensure access to natural resources,
            through the customary, or traditional land tenure systems of
            such groups. Monitoring by representatives of indigenous
            groups should be promoted, supported by experienced social
            experts who should report on the adequate process being
            implemented, an evaluation of which should be made available
            to the public.
